greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Matrix square of triangle W = A136231; also equals P^6, where P = triangle A136220.
formula: Column k of W^2 (this triangle) = column 1 of W^(k+1), where W = P^3 and P = triangle A136220.
example: where column 0 of W^2 = column 1 of W = triangle A136231.
program: (PARI) {T(n,k)=local(P=Mat(1),U=Mat(1),W=Mat(1),PShR);if(n>0,for(i=0,n, PShR=matrix(#P,#P, r,c, if(r>=c,if(r==c,1,if(c==1,0,P[r-1,c-1])))); U=P*PShR^2; U=matrix(#P+1, #P+1, r,c, if(r>=c, if(r<#P+1,U[r,c], if(c==1,(P^3)[ #P,1],(P^(3*c-1))[r-c+1,1])))); P=matrix(#U, #U, r,c, if(r>=c, if(r<#R,P[r,c], (U^c)[r-c+1,1]))); W=P^3;));(W^2)[n+1,k+1]}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Feb 07 2008
